pullRequest.body:
This adds duality statements for finite abelian groups.
It also fixes some docstrings and adds a missing namespace that was left out by accident in a previous PR,

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [40091de581](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18738/commits/40091de581b4b5fc6b8362110e4bcfa050db7e60)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.GroupTheory.FiniteAbelian.Duality`|1586|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsCyclic.monoidHom_equiv_self`
`+ dvd_exponent`
`+ equiv_prod_multiplicative_zmod_of_finite`
`+ exists_apply_ne_one_aux`
`+ exists_apply_ne_one_of_hasEnoughRootsOfUnity`
`+ mulEquiv_monoidHom_of_hasEnoughRootsOfUnity`
`- equiv_prod_multiplicative_zmod`
`- monoidHom_equiv_self`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: MichaelStollBayreuth can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
How much does this overlap with #15999?
Oooh, good you spotted it!

> Can you maybe add a TODO?

What do you think needs to be done that should go into the TODO?

> > Can you maybe add a TODO?
> 
> What do you think needs to be done that should go into the TODO?

Well, I don't know, but as you explained on Zulip this is part of a series of PRs to get to a result about characters. Anyway if you don't have precise plans for this file don't worry.

> How much does this overlap with #15999?

There is some overlap in the theory behind it, but there are a few differences.
* What you do is for additive characters and target `ℂ` (or `Circle`), whereas what I do is for multiplicative groups (multiplicative characters and Dirichlet characters to follow) and more general targets (that have "enough roots of unity").
* You do the double dual isomorphism, which I don't do (but could be added, of course).

One can probably transfer most results from the multiplicative to the additive setting (note that a `HasEnoughRootsOfUnity` instance for algebraically closed fields of characteristic zero will be added soon), to avoid code duplication.

> Well, I don't know, but as you explained on Zulip this is part of a series of PRs to get to a result about characters. Anyway if you don't have precise plans for this file don't worry.

The follow-up PRs will be about multiplicative characters and then Dirichlet characters, and will go into their own possibly new) files, so a TODO here does not make a lot of sense.

I would be interested in doing anything that gets a version of Pontryagin duality for finite abelian groups in mathlib. All the interesting stuff in APAP has been waiting on #15999 for almost three months now

My idea was to get the (noncanonical) isomorphism with the character group with only the minimally necessary assumptions on the target; that's why I introduced the `HasEnoughRootsOfUnity` typeclass a few PRs back. With the right instances, this will work directly for targets like `ℂ` (and one can easily deduce an instance for `Circle` as well).
OK, then I'll hit "merge" on this one and hope that it will be useful for you.

Let's forget about the TODO.

Concerning #15999, it seems at the moment that there is little overlap, maybe no overlap at all, so I think we can merge this one. (And @YaelDillies feel free to ping an analyst to have a review!)
Maybe I'll have some time tomorrow to look at [#15999](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15999), too.
bors r+

@YaelDillies I haven't added the `HasEnoughRootsOfUnity` instance for algebraically closed fields of characteristic zero in `RingTheory,RootsOfUnity.EnoughRootsOfUnity` because of the necessary import increase. Should I add it in a separate file (maybe together with an instance for `Circle`)? I had planned to include it with the material on Dirichlet characters, but it doesn't really fit well there either, so a separate file (under `RingTheory.RootsOfUnity`) looks like a reasonable solution.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11732132564/job/32683716846)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11732132564/job/32683717884)

> Should I add it in a separate file (maybe together with an instance for Circle)?

Yes please, sounds like a good compromise!

Can you maybe add a TODO? Anyway thanks!

bors d+

Can you maybe add a TODO? Anyway thanks!

bors d+

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(GroupTheory/FiniteAbelian/Duality): new file
